Dear Ms. Thomas-Cloud:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
October 20, 2021. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the
contract and Modified Implementation Sustainability, and Exit Plan (MISEP)
requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations
of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved; this includes identifying
behaviorally specific action steps.
o Repeat violations must include an explanation of why the previous
corrective action plan did not result in compliance.
 Individuals directly responsible for implementing the corrective action step for
each licensing statute and rule, Contract item, DHHS policy or MISEP section
citation, e.g., workers, supervisors, program managers, director, etc.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
implemented and completed.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved; this
includes identifying specific action steps for continuous monitoring.
 Signature of the responsible party and date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the
following information prior to employment or at the time
specified in this rule:
(c) Verification of high school diploma or GED when
specified by rule.
One of five employee records reviewed did not have verification of a high school
diploma in the record.
R 400.4144 Admission health screening; physical examinations.
(1) An initial health screening shall be completed for each
resident within 24 hours of admission to a facility.
One of three active youth case files reviewed did not have the 24-hour initial health
screening completed within 24-hours.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not in need of technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not seek consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The first corrective action plan was regarding their 2020 Annual Licensing Inspection.
4

The second corrective action plan was regarding Special Investigation
2020C0214035 which was initiated on 6/22/2020. The allegations involved a direct
care staff using profanity when dealing with a youth. The allegations were
substantiated, and the facility was found to be in noncompliance with Rule 400.4123
(Sufficiency of staff). The approved corrective action plan regarding this violation
involved disciplinary action against the staff involved in the incident along with training
for all staff. This training involved de-escalation techniques, staff supporting each
other, mindfulness, Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) and self-care training. The
facility indicated they will monitor each staff’s training in more depth and talk with staff
during staff meetings about potential issues.
Interviews were conducted and involved one of the three youth. One youth was off
site at school and the other youth refused to be interviewed. The one youth
interviewed was very positive and indicated feelings safe and having her needs met
at the facility. She also reported the staff are watchful and provide positive
interactions. The direct care staff interviewed reported feeling supported by the
administration and having “a lot of trainings” to help them in their interactions with the
youth. The supervisor and administration staff report adjusting to the change in their
contract but being able to provide the appropriate level of care for the youth. They
also present with a best practice focus.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
